column4: also not that you can nest one within the other, which is why there are two ways to do it

no.. i had the text editor
you can quickly search through each file in there by doing "grep SEARCH_STRING /etc/cron.daily/*"
have you search string be part of the command that gets run
do the same thing for /etc/cron.d/ see if you are calling a script not inside /etc/cron.daily
agreed... why are you using crontab?
you might want to look into using /etc/cron.daily and /etc/cron.d for this kind of thing in the future =)
alright, so how do I ago about executing /home/kaitlyn/Desktop/backup every night at 4am?
cat out any one of the files in /etc/cron.d and you will get an idea
